column4: what will happen if I installed the libc6 from jaunty into intrepid?
I had to update to the mdadm in jaunty
because the mdadm in intrepid is broken
aptitude -s install that_package and see what changes
but like said it might break something
it also forces an update when there is an higher version
you do have the jaunty repo already enabled in your sources.list?
yes but I changed it back already
if you enable it, run an update and do apt-cache policy you can see the candidate, and simulate the install action, it will show you what will be upgraded..

It has already been installed.  I had to install mdadm and udev from jaunty so that I could assemble by broken raid5 array.  The mdadm in intrepid seg faults with assembling broken arrays... https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/mdadm/+bug/282492
stupid question perhaps, but why not upgrade to jaunty?
I don't know, this was all done over email with a friend... I told him not to upgrade it...
it could work, with debian you can mix and match between stable, testing and unstable as well
I don't know.  That is way I use debian
